definition: hissing sound/to hiss (as a sign of displeasure)
to hiss (as a sign of displeasure)

sentences.english: The crowd greeted the performers with boos and hiss es.
sentences.chinese: 觀衆向演出者發出一片噓聲。

sentences.english: He arrived boos at a federal courthouse in Richmond, Virginia.
sentences.chinese: 他在維吉尼亞理德曼的聯邦法院遭到了陣陣噓聲。

sentences.english: With a sibilant hiss, the Things began to move.
sentences.chinese: 藉由一聲絲絲作聲的噓聲，事物開始移動。

sentences.english: His speeches were met with catcalls.
sentences.chinese: 對他的演講，人們報以噓聲。

sentences.english: However, they occasionally snort, hiss, or bark.
sentences.chinese: 不過啞天鵝偶爾會發出呼哧聲，噓聲，或吼聲。

sentences.english: There were catcalls and stuff, and people would always come up and try to dance with .
sentences.chinese: 周圍總是有噓聲什麼的，人們喜歡走過來跟跳舞。

sentences.english: Yes, I know cut the catcalls!
sentences.chinese: 是的，我知道，省了那噓聲吧。

sentences.english: The minister's speech was greeted with jeers and catcalls.
sentences.chinese: 這位大臣的講話遭到嘲笑，噓聲四起。

sentences.english: He was really getting tired of the catcalls and the manhandling.
sentences.chinese: 他真是受夠那些噓聲和毛毛躁躁的騷擾了。

sentences.english: She was greeted with boos and hisses.
When he was snubbed by the Oscars, there was a collective gasp heard around the world.
sentences.chinese: 當他於奧斯卡獎擦肩而過時，全世界都發出了噓聲。
他發出噓聲趕走他離開。

sentences.english: I been chewed up and spit out and booed off stage.
sentences.chinese: 我仔細咀嚼，再吐出來，並且發出噓聲。

sentences.english: The football fans hissed when he didn't kick the ball.
sentences.chinese: 當他踢空了一腳球時，球迷們發出了一陣噓噓聲。

sentences.english: His speech was greeted with loud hoots.
sentences.chinese: 他的演講遭到了輕蔑的噓聲。

sentences.english: Well, they're not booing anymore when I say that.
sentences.chinese: 我這麼說完以後就再沒有噓聲了。

definition: gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to be reluctant to give up a post
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
